title: How to Make a Vegan Pumpkin Spice Latte

steps.headline: Combine the syrup with the soy milk and pumpkin purée in a small pan.
steps.description: Heat on medium heat. It should be hot but not boiling. Stir frequently until it starts steaming. Take off the heat immediately if it starts bubbling or boiling. If you don't have syrup you can replace it with another sweetener such as agave nectar or sugar. Honey is not a vegan sweetener, so if you want to make it vegan, avoid using honey. It is important that you use plain pumpkin purée and not pumpkin pie blend or canned purée which has extra ingredients.

steps.headline: Add the pumpkin spice mix and whisk.
steps.description: If you don't have a pumpkin spice mix, you can make one by combining ¼ tsp cinnamon, ⅛ teaspoon ginger, a pinch of nutmeg and a pinch of allspice. If you don't have enough spices, you can just use a teaspoon of cinnamon.

steps.headline: Take the pan off the heat and add in half a cup of strong, brewed coffee.
steps.description: Alternatively you could add one or two shots of espresso. Do not use regular coffee or it will be too milky.

steps.headline: Add the vanilla extract and mix well.
steps.description: You can give the vanilla a miss if you want a less sweet latte. For a variation, you could replace the vanilla with a nut butter.

steps.headline: Put the mixture in a blender if you desire.
steps.description: Blend the mixture until it is foamy and frothy. The mixture should be completely smooth. This step is not necessary but can improve the recipe.

steps.headline: Pour the drink into a mug to serve.
steps.description: You could also divide the latte in two mugs to have two smaller drinks.

steps.headline: Top the drink with coconut whipped cream or any other vegan whipped cream and a sprinkle of pumpkin spice mix or ground cinnamon.
steps.description: You can get creative on how you top the drink. You could grate vegan chocolate over the latte, if you wish. You can garnish with a stick of cinnamon.

text: Combine the syrup with the soy milk and pumpkin purée in a small pan. Heat on medium heat. It should be hot but not boiling. Stir frequently until it starts steaming. Take off the heat immediately if it starts bubbling or boiling. If you don't have syrup you can replace it with another sweetener such as agave nectar or sugar. Honey is not a vegan sweetener, so if you want to make it vegan, avoid using honey. It is important that you use plain pumpkin purée and not pumpkin pie blend or canned purée which has extra ingredients. Add the pumpkin spice mix and whisk. If you don't have a pumpkin spice mix, you can make one by combining ¼ tsp cinnamon, ⅛ teaspoon ginger, a pinch of nutmeg and a pinch of allspice. If you don't have enough spices, you can just use a teaspoon of cinnamon. Take the pan off the heat and add in half a cup of strong, brewed coffee. Alternatively you could add one or two shots of espresso. Do not use regular coffee or it will be too milky. Add the vanilla extract and mix well. You can give the vanilla a miss if you want a less sweet latte. For a variation, you could replace the vanilla with a nut butter. Put the mixture in a blender if you desire. Blend the mixture until it is foamy and frothy. The mixture should be completely smooth. This step is not necessary but can improve the recipe. Pour the drink into a mug to serve. You could also divide the latte in two mugs to have two smaller drinks. Top the drink with coconut whipped cream or any other vegan whipped cream and a sprinkle of pumpkin spice mix or ground cinnamon. You can get creative on how you top the drink. You could grate vegan chocolate over the latte, if you wish. You can garnish with a stick of cinnamon. Enjoy!
